SEARCH
Package de.fherfurt.lat.api.resources

Klasse CalendarResource

java.lang.Object
de.fherfurt.lat.api.resources.CalendarResource
public class CalendarResource extends Object
RESTful resource class for managing calendar entries.

This resource provides endpoints to retrieve, create, and manage calendar entries. It interacts with the ICalendarService to perform CRUD operations on calendar entries, and uses the Mapper to convert between entities and data transfer objects (DTOs).

The following HTTP methods are supported:

  • GET - Retrieve all calendar entries or a specific entry by ID
  • POST - Create a new calendar entry
Siehe auch:
  • ICalendarService
  • Mapper
  • CalendarService
  • CalendarEntryDto

  • Konstruktordetails

    • CalendarResource

      public CalendarResource()
      Constructs a new CalendarResource and initializes the calendar service.

      The CalendarService is used as the implementation of ICalendarService.

  • Methodendetails

    • getCalendarEntries

      @GET @Produces("application/json") public List<CalendarEntryDto> getCalendarEntries()
      Retrieves a list of all calendar entries.

      This method maps the CalendarEntry entities to CalendarEntryDto objects and returns them as a JSON list.

      Gibt zurück:
      a list of CalendarEntryDto objects representing all calendar entries.

    • getEntry

      @GET @Path("{entryId:\\d+}") @Produces("application/json") public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getEntry(@PathParam("entryId") int entryId)
      Retrieves a specific calendar entry by its ID.

      If the calendar entry with the specified ID is found, it is returned as a JSON response. If not found, a 404 (Not Found) status is returned.

      Parameter:
      entryId - the ID of the calendar entry to retrieve.
      Gibt zurück:
      a Response containing the CalendarEntryDto if found, or a 404 status if not found.

    • createEntry

      @POST @Consumes("application/json") @Produces("application/json") public javax.ws.rs.core.Response createEntry(CalendarEntryDto entryDto, @Context javax.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers)
      Creates a new calendar entry.

      This method accepts a CalendarEntryDto in the request body, converts it to a CalendarEntry entity, and attempts to save it using the calendar service. If the calendar entry is successfully created, a 201 (Created) status is returned. If the creation fails, a 304 (Not Modified) status is returned.

      Parameter:
      entryDto - the CalendarEntryDto representing the calendar entry to be created.
      headers - the HTTP headers of the request (optional, used for additional context if needed).
      Gibt zurück:
      a Response indicating the outcome of the create operation.
